document.docAuthor: Xue, Xiao-Feng, Song, Zi-Wei & Hong, Xiao-Yue
document.masterDocTitle: Five new species of the genus Tegolophus Keifer (Acari: Eriophyidae: Phyllocoptinae: Anthocoptini) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Five new species of the genus Tegolophus Keifer (Acari: Eriophyidae: Phyllocoptinae: Anthocoptini) from China

heading.emphasis:
Key to
Tegolophus
species from China

paragraph.keyLead:
6 Female
genital coverflap with granules at base
........................... Tegolophus rubrae
Huang & Wang, 2004

7 Admedian lines present
......................................................... Tegolophus fontanesiae
Kuang & Hong, 1991

- Admedian lines absent
...................................... Tegolophus ringsi
Styer, 1975
;
Kuang, Luo & Wang, 2005

9 Scapular tubercles large
................................................ Tegolophus magnutuberclus
Huang & Wang, 2004

- Scapular tubercles normal
......................................................... Tegolophus melicopi
Huang & Wang, 2004

- Median line absent
.............................................................. Tegolophus eminentopus
Huang & Wang, 2004

17 Coxal area with short lines
........................................................... Tegolophus paliurus
Kuang & Lin, 2001

- Coxal area with granules
............................................. Tegolophus zizyphagus
(
Keifer), 1939
;
Kuang, 1995

19 Median and admedian lines connected at basal 2 / 3
.................... Tegolophus syringae
Lin & Kuang, 2001 b

21 Coxal area Ð† with granules, coxal area II smooth
................... Tegolophus polygonus
Huang & Wang, 2004

- Coxal area with short lines
................................................ Tegolophus hunanensis
Lin, Jin & Kuang, 1997

23 Median line present, empodium 8 -rayed
........... Tegolophus bashaniae
Xue, Song,
Amrine & Hong, 2006

- Median line absent, empodium 4 -rayed
........................................................ Tegolophus floridumis
sp. nov.

25 Admedian lines connected
................................... Tegolophus fargesiae
Xue, Song,
Amrine & Hong, 2006

27 Median and admedian lines connected at basal 1 / 3
...................................... Tegolophus picrasmae
sp. nov.

- Median and admedian lines connected at basal 1 / 4 and center
................ Tegolophus suffruticosae
sp. nov.

28 Prodorsal shield with granules, dorsal annuli with filament microtubercles
Tegolophus changbais
sp. nov.
